Abstract: New York Stock Exchange sets level for trading halt in United States equity markets at drop of 1,100 points in Dow Jones industrial average; change will take effect on Jan 3, first trading day of first quarter (M)
Snippet: New York Stock Exchange sets level for trading halt in United States equity markets at drop of 1,100 points in Dow Jones industrial average; change will take effect on Jan 3, first trading day of first quarter (M)
LeadParagraph: In its quarterly adjustment of ''circuit breakers,'' the New York Stock Exchange set the level for a trading halt in United States equity markets at a drop of 1,100 points in the Dow Jones industrial average.

Headline.Main: N.Y.S.E. Sets Levels for Trading Halts
Headline.PrintHeadline: N.Y.S.E. Sets Levels for Trading Halts
